resources.string: aprs.tools is written by Ellen Poe, and it is distributed under the terms of the GNU General Public License, version 3. Ellen reminds users of aprs.tools to follow all laws governing the use of amateur radio equipment and frequencies in your area. Precautions have been taken to reduce the risk of major bugs and spurious transmissions, but it is your sole responsibility to ensure your equipment, including any software you use to operate your station, is functioning properly and configured correctly. If you need to contact the developer, you can email her at ellen.h.poe+aprstools@gmail.com. Please don\'t remove the +aprstools tag because it lets me keep my email organized. You can find a copy of the aprs.tools source on GitHub at https://github.com/ellenpoe/aprs.tools.
You need a government-issued amateur radio callsign to use many features of this software. Please enter it below.
You need an APRS-IS passcode to use this feature. Please enter it below.
This is a list of third party software that makes aprs.tools tick. Big thank you to the open source community for creating wonderful tools. Without these projects, aprs.tools wouldn\'t exist.
